definition: (literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
to take a casual remark to heart (idiom)
pinyin: yan2 zhe3 wu2 yi4 , ting1 zhe3 you3 xin1

sentences.english: Conviction of preacher passes into truth of hearers .
sentences.chinese: 講道者的信念，使聽者扎心知罪，認識真理。

sentences.english: I am a much better listener, " he said."
Several people talking at once distract a listener.
sentences.chinese: 幾個人同時講話會使聽者分散注意力。

sentences.english: Mother and daughter stood pressed against the wall and saw and heard the raging of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 母女站着緊靠着牆壁，看着，聽者大火的肆虐。

sentences.english: Depending on the placement, aim this speaker either up or down to point directly at the listener.
sentences.chinese: 基於這個佈置，音箱或高或低的正對着收聽者。

sentences.english: These reasons operated on the mind of the hearer.
sentences.chinese: 這些道理在聽者思想上產生了作用。

sentences.english: And females of these animals can be fussy listeners.
sentences.chinese: 在上述物種中，雌性動物便是不易取悅的收聽者。

sentences.english: However, during the one-hour play, only six or seven people were truly appreciating the charming music.
sentences.chinese: 將遠一小時的演奏中，真正坐足凝聽者只要六七人。

sentences.english: Whence comes it that it suddenly impresses itself on the attention of those who hear it?
sentences.chinese: 它又怎麼會突然吸引住聽者的注意力？

definition: to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
not knowing which course to follow (idiom); at a loss what to do
to find amusement in one's own way/to enjoy oneself quietly
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
to stir/to prod/to poke/to move sideways/to strum (on a guitar etc)
